intro: Pityopsis ruthii, commonly known as the Ruth's golden aster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, yellowish to orange-colored composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, often forming a rosette near the ground. Pityopsis ruthii is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
